page.title: 02Old Erringham Farm
page.content: Old Erringham Farm, which has been in existence since the 12th Century, extends to 480 acres. A public footpath runs through the farm, and visitors are able to see Old Erringham Hall, the Norman Barn and the tiny Chapel, all listed buildings. The present tenant farmer has about 400 sheep, Southdown and Romney, and the public are urged to keep their dogs under control as he has lost several sheep due to dog worrying. He has 5 tractors and carries out all the work himself with the help of 4 men. He cultivates 300 acres where he grows cereals and green feed. He is currently experimenting with a silage machine and stores the silage in huge plastic bags.
